comment.author: 35317829@N06
comment._content: Depending on the exact date this ship is either the P&O Moldavia or Mongolia. Chances are it's the latter because in 1928 the Moldavia was refitted, given a second funnel and upper works painted white. The Mongolia had a surprisingly long life, sailing for a time as the New Zealand steamship Company's Rimutaka and ended her days as the Mexican cruise ship Acapulco. A photo of the Mongolia: upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/2/24/SS_Mongolia_1... Cheers, Phill

comment.author: 35317829@N06
comment._content: The progress on the pylon is very close, I wonder if it was taken by the same photographer?

comment.author: 33147718@N05
comment._content: [http://www.flickr.com/photos/35317829@N06] It is indeed, although it is difficult to be sure if it is the same photographer, especially when we don't have the photographer's name either. It does look a bit like a Samuel J Hood photograph though...
